section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Gond, The Word Of The Devotees.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When you meet a Saint, talk to him and listen.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meeting with an unsaintly person, just remain silent. ||1||

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O father, if I speak, what words should I utter?

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਜੈਸੇ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਰਵਿ ਰਹੀਐ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Speak such words, by which you may remain absorbed in the Name of the Lord. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jaisē rām nām rav rahīai .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Speaking with the Saints, one becomes generous.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: To speak with a fool is to babble uselessly. ||2||

translation.text: By speaking and only speaking, corruption only increases.

translation.text: If I do not speak, what can the poor wretch do? ||3||

text: ਭਰਿਆ ਹੋਇ ਸੁ ਕਬਹੁ ਨ ਡੋਲੈ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: but that which is full makes no sound. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: bhariā hōi s kabah n dōlai .4.1.
